snippet: A federal appeals court on Tuesday cleared the way for same-sex marriages to begin Monday in Alabama, but the state’s attorney general made a last-ditch attempt to keep the weddings on hold.
abstract: Alabama Atty Gen Luther Strange asks United States Supreme Court to delay same-sex weddings in state until justices reach nationwide consensus on issue; request follows ruling finding state's ban on same-sex marriage unconstitutional.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court on Tuesday cleared the way for same-sex marriages to begin Monday in Alabama, but the state’s attorney general made a last-ditch attempt to keep the weddings on hold.

headline.main: Alabama: Court Refuses to Delay Same-Sex Marriages
headline.print_headline: Alabama: Court Refuses to Delay Same-Sex Marriages

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
